Analytical dashboards
Dashboards are used to visualize data.
Information can be presented in the form of a table, graph, chart, etc.
To select a dashboard, drag and drop the Dashboard tab items into the profile.
Adding a dashboard to a profile is done by dragging an element.
When clicking the
button above the analytical panel name, the following settings will become available.
Setting
Purpose
Delete the panel from the dashboard.
Move up/down relative to panels in the same row.
Clear visual options.
Hide the panel. When active, the panel will be hidden from the dashboard but will remain available in the visual editing mode.
Hide the background. When active, the panel will be displayed on the dashboard without background and borders.
Hiding the background is available for analytical panels of the following dashboards:
"Table"
,
"Structural diagram"
,
"Dynamics chart"
,
"Linear chart"
,
"Custom highcharts"
, "Object profile".
Set the height value of the analytical dashboard area in relation to the screen height (set as a percentage).
This option is available for analytical dashboards
“Table”
,
“Slider with charts”
,
“Key indicators”
, “Task list”,
“Sprint”
, “Table with indicators,”
“OLAP”
, “Object profile,”
“Hyperlinks”
, “Print form,”
“Kanban board”
,
“Control element”
.
The default value is 50%.
